# Bakker

> Lightweight, self-hosted MariaDB/MySQL backup service with a web UI, REST API, and cron-based scheduling.

## Overview

- Runs in Docker and stores all state under a mounted `/data` volume.
- Uses cron inside the container for scheduled backups and retention.
- `AUTH_TOKEN` is required in production. All `/api/*` routes require `Authorization: Bearer <token>`.
- If `ENCRYPTION_SECRET` is set, stored DB passwords are encrypted at rest.

## API

- [GET /api/config] - read current config
- [PUT /api/config] - update config (validates cron + database references)
- [GET /api/backups] - list backups grouped by database
- [GET /api/backups/:filename] - download a backup
- [DELETE /api/backups/:filename] - delete a backup
- [POST /api/backups/trigger] - trigger a backup now
- [GET /api/status] - current backup status
- [GET /api/logs] - tail backup log
- [GET /api/templates] - list templates
- [POST /api/templates] - create template
- [PUT /api/templates/:name] - update template
- [DELETE /api/templates/:name] - delete template
- [GET /api/passwords] - list configs with stored passwords
- [POST /api/passwords/:configName] - store password
- [DELETE /api/passwords/:configName] - delete password
- [POST /api/test-connection] - test DB connection
